sentences.english: Now Charlie knows that all BINGO Kids have to do chores.
sentences.chinese: 现在查理知道了，所有的宾果孩子们都要做家务。

sentences.english: The local cinema has been made into a bingo hall .
sentences.chinese: 当地的电影院已被改成宾果游戏厅了。

sentences.english: It is now available at Bingo Runner.
sentences.chinese: 它现在是可利用的在宾果游戏赛跑者。

sentences.english: House of Bingo Can you beat this ?
sentences.chinese: 宾果之家你能不能战胜呢？

sentences.english: Will we play bingo on Sundays nights?
sentences.chinese: 周日晚上我们可以玩宾果游戏吗？
我们连宾果游戏都不允许玩。

sentences.english: Need a template for bingo halls.
sentences.chinese: 宾果游戏大厅需要一个模板。

sentences.english: There was a farmer with a goat, And Bingo was his name-o.
sentences.chinese: 这里有一个农民带着一只山羊，宾果是他的名字。

sentences.english: Play bingo to determine who goes first.
I'll hazard a dollar on the bingo game.
sentences.chinese: 我在这局宾果游戏上赌一美元。

sentences.english: The host looks after it carefully every day and Bingo helps to guard the house.
sentences.chinese: 它主人每天都悉心照顾它，而宾果也会每天帮忙看家。

sentences.english: An early form of bingo was first played in Italy in 1530.
sentences.chinese: 一五三0年，在义大利第一次有人玩早期版本的宾果。

sentences.english: Supporters also enjoyed a stand-up bingo and a hot-pot supper.
sentences.chinese: 球迷非常享受宾果游戏和丰盛晚餐。

sentences.english: Play bingo to determine who goes next.
sentences.chinese: 玩宾果游戏来决定谁去下一个。

definition: (usually used in the negative) to answer or reply to sb's question
(Internet slang) (loanword) #MeToo (movement against sexual harassment and assault)
to compete to be the first to answer a question (as on a quiz show)
Oh! (exclamation of dismay etc)/see 呦呦[you1 you1]
(particle) marker of surprise, sudden realization, reminder
(Tw) (Internet slang) Greetings! (used when it's unknown what time the reader will see one's post, or just to be cute)
